trans-unit.source: Setting Timeouts for Table Service Operations
trans-unit.target: Setting Timeouts for Table Service Operations

trans-unit.source: A call to a Table service API can include a server timeout interval, specified in the <codeInline>timeout</codeInline> parameter of the request URI.
trans-unit.target: A call to a Table service API can include a server timeout interval, specified in the <codeInline>timeout</codeInline> parameter of the request URI.

trans-unit.source: If the server timeout interval elapses before the service has finished processing the request, the service returns an error.
trans-unit.target: If the server timeout interval elapses before the service has finished processing the request, the service returns an error.

trans-unit.source: The maximum timeout interval for Table service operations is 30 seconds.
trans-unit.target: The maximum timeout interval for Table service operations is 30 seconds.

trans-unit.source: The Table service automatically reduces any timeouts larger than 30 seconds to the 30-second maximum.
trans-unit.target: The Table service automatically reduces any timeouts larger than 30 seconds to the 30-second maximum.

trans-unit.source: The Table service enforces server timeouts as follows:
trans-unit.target: The Table service enforces server timeouts as follows:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Query operations:</embeddedLabel> During the timeout interval, a query may execute for up to a maximum of five seconds.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Query operations:</embeddedLabel> During the timeout interval, a query may execute for up to a maximum of five seconds.

trans-unit.source: If the query does not complete within the five-second interval, the response includes continuation tokens for retrieving remaining items on a subsequent request.
trans-unit.target: If the query does not complete within the five-second interval, the response includes continuation tokens for retrieving remaining items on a subsequent request.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="d962e4c0-709a-4f04-a296-32a49d82c799" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Timeout and Pagination</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="d962e4c0-709a-4f04-a296-32a49d82c799" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Timeout and Pagination</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Insert, update, and delete operations:</embeddedLabel> The maximum timeout interval is 30 seconds.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Insert, update, and delete operations:</embeddedLabel> The maximum timeout interval is 30 seconds.

trans-unit.source: Thirty seconds is also the default interval for all insert, update, and delete operations.
trans-unit.target: Thirty seconds is also the default interval for all insert, update, and delete operations.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a timeout interval that is greater than 30 seconds, the Table service uses 30 seconds.
trans-unit.target: If you specify a timeout interval that is greater than 30 seconds, the Table service uses 30 seconds.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a timeout that is less than the service's default timeout, your timeout interval will be used.
trans-unit.target: If you specify a timeout that is less than the service's default timeout, your timeout interval will be used.
